The phenotype and the mutator locus were considered evolving traits for the model. At the beginning of each simulation run, the population composed of 1000 individuals, at carrying capacity K, was assumed to be locally adapted. Therefore the alleles coding for the phenotype were initialized randomly from a normal distribution centered in θ
0 and variance V = VG / 2 L, where VG is the initial genetic variance present in the population, and L the number of loci which was set to 1 for all runs in this study.
